main.name: Tim Baker
main.description: I am a product manager passionate about the intersection of technology, financial services, and economic empowerment
main.bio: I am a product manager passionate about the intersection of technology, financial services, and economic empowerment. Currently, I am working on insurance analytics at EagleView Technologies.
main.contactmessage: Shoot me a message on LinkedIn if you want to chat!

education.description: Bachelor of Science, Finance (Magna Cum Laude); Bachelor of Science, Economics (Cum Laude); University of Maryland Honors College, Wall Street Fellow, Robert H. Smith Business School Honors

work.title: Associate Product Manager, Insurance Analytics
work.description: EagleView (a Vista Equity | Clearlake Capital portfolio company) is a leader in geospatial technology, providing software, imagery and analytics that transform the way our customers work. EagleView has the largest geospatial data and imagery library in history, covering 98% of the U.S. population.

work.title: Associate, FiscalNote Markets
work.description: Designed data products for hedge fund clients; gathered product requirements, worked with engineering, data science, and marketing stakeholders to define critical features, scope, and roadmap. Analyzed organic and inorganic growth alternatives; advised in the acquisition and integration of a financial data provider. Coordinated business development strategy; managed relationships with HF/PE clients across investment research, due diligence, and data products.

work.title: Associate, Portfolio Management (Whole Loans)
work.description: Led a team of 4 engineers to build and deliver a portfolio analytics platform, outlining requirements, sourcing (often disparate) data streams, detailing business logic, testing, and deploying solutions.  The platform brought in millions of data points, systematically performing normalizations, transformations, and model calculations; the front-end visualization tool was leveraged across multiple lines of business. Modeled deal economics for multiple ~$4B credit-linked note transactions; calibrated credit/interest rate model parameters to develop bespoke scenarios for analysis of hold, sale, and securitization alternatives. Managed the pre-2008 portfolio (~$20B AUM); wrote scripts informing trading strategies (securitization/sale/hedging). Collaborated across research teams to validate stochastic cashflow modeling; investigated and tested business impacts of quarterly model releases. Coordinated with tech partners on benchmark interest rate conversion (LIBOR/SOFR). Monitored and projected the impact of COVID-19 on consumer credit characteristics across the portfolio (~$140B AUM); frequently presented analysis, insights, and recommendations to senior management.

work.title: Analyst, Non-Agency Mortgage-Backed Securities Trading
work.description: Analyzed and bid pools of mortgage loans ($10-$25MM); assisted in structuring bespoke offers for clients (~$80MM). Managed pricing, trade stipulations, and policy guidance with investor/bank clients over email, phone, and BBG IM. Developed relationships with marquee clients; negotiated pricing on trade settlements ranging from $10-$150MM. Prototyped and designed alongside technology teams to build and test database tools for daily trading data/color.

work.title: Summer Analyst, Markets: Trading
work.description: Identified potential clients for JPM mortgage bonds and derivatives; pitched CMO securities to the MBS trading team. Developed daily market briefings concerning topics in spread products, structured finance, and global rates markets. Automated stratification and analysis of mortgage data using SAS and VBA to support cashflow modeling and valuation.

work.company: United States Department of the Treasury
work.title: Intern, Office of Capital Markets
work.description: Composed an informational memorandum briefing Secretary Mnuchin on heightened leverage levels in U.S. corporates. Presented to Asst. Secretary of Financial Markets on high frequency trading reform and cross-market synchronization. Pulled yield, spread, and interest rate data from Bloomberg to examine economic cycle positioning/U.S. financial stability.

work.company: United States Securities and Exchange Commission
work.title: Intern, Division of Economic and Risk Analysis
work.description: Evaluated feedback from the European Securities and Markets Authority on data management and standardization. Summarized thousands of pages of Congressional legislation regarding data standards to assist the Division of Economic and Risk Analysis team.
